intro: Hippocratea molunduina, commonly known as the Molunduina hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental value.
